Review Title: A budget hotel in a good location, in an expensive city, with many groups of guests.
Negative Reviews: There was no iron or ironing board or safe in the room, though there was communal washing and ironing facilities on another floor. The bathroom amenities provided were small sizes, and although holders for larger containers were installed, the containers and liquids were not. Small bugs were noted at times in the bathroom area. The air conditioning and fan was difficult to adjust and the temperature of the room was often freezing. The folding luggage rack was broken in arrival and never fixed.
Positive Reviews: The location was good, near an MRT, and handy for the business districts. The hotel appears generally of a three plus star standard. the rooms are small, though generally adequate for a short stay. It is a budget hotel and you get what you pay for. Tea and coffee were provided in the room and replenished daily. The Staff were generally friendly and efficient.

Negative Reviews:
The whole stay was a disappointment. I have stayed in 2-star hotels that offer you more and that are more spacious than this alleged 4-star.

The pictures of the rooms are very very deceiving, they are real, but taken in a way that make them look way bigger than they are. They feel like one of those ‚Äúcube‚Äù hotels, but with the bare minimum space to walk around the bed. There was almost no space for luggage. We had to keep it closed all the time.

The bathroom is tiny. Trying to get dried inside the shower without touching the walls was nearly impossible.

In general it felt more like camping in an RV than being in a hotel.

Also, only one side table (there was space for two small ones), no night lamps, no minibar‚Ä¶

The mattress was quite hard, as well as the pillows. If you like that, you‚Äôll feel in heaven. But I prefer softer pillows, so I went down to ask for an extra one. It was brought to the room without a pillow case. So I had to go down again (tbf, the reception guy was as surprised as me).

I think the hotel has an ‚Äúexpectations‚Äù problem. I have stayed in worse hotels for cheap, but at least they don‚Äôt try to sell it as something else. Maybe if they told it as it is, I wouldn‚Äôt be writing this.

At Boss, it was just one disappointment after another.

Negative Reviews:
The rooms are very cramped and crowded. A room for 4 could barely hold my party and our luggages with very limited space to move around. Only stay here if you're very comfortable with the people you are traveling with. Luckily we were, otherwise this would have been very uncomfortable. 

The coin laundry at this facility is poorly managed and very expensive. S$5 for wash and S$5 for dry for only about 45 minutes, with additional S$1 for detergent. It's located outdoors in this tiny corner that is hard to walk through since everyone is crowding around the machines waiting to dump other people's laundry out as soon as the load is finished. The control panel is hard to understand, since for some reason they taped over the S$5 option with black tape, so it made a single wash load S$10. When I asked for help they just told me that was the cost and refused to come help. Then I removed the black tape on my own and found that there were cheaper load options. Staff was very rude and unhelpful in this regard. The dryer didn't even dry our clothes so we ended up paying S$5 for wet laundry that we had to hang dry in our room overnight and into the next day.
Positive Reviews:
I liked that the hotel was located right in front of a bus stop that was serviced by many bus lines. This made it very convenient to get around on public transportation as the stop is right in front of the entrance. 
The room was clean enough and passable for staying in. 

Checkout was at 1pm which was nice.

Review Title: Place was great. Super accessible. Staff was the best. They were very helpful and understanding.
Negative Reviews:

Positive Reviews:
- Location is great. Walking distance to a lot of good restaurants and mustafa shopping centre which we aimed to shop at from the get go. 
- Staff service is superb. They extended the checkout by 4 hours from 11am to 3pm once they found out our flight as not till later that evening. Massive help to us. 
- Cleanliness of room is great. Beds very comfy.

Negative Reviews: During the night we could hear a buzzing noise (perhaps air-conditioning units in neighbouring rooms). We got used to this after a couple of nights but could be a problem for light sleepers.
Positive Reviews: A great mid-range hotel. It's not the most luxurious hotel I have ever stayed in but provided everything we needed for a comfortable stay of 6 nights. Staff were very helpful. Great location - close to a bus stop and the subway line too. Great value for money in our opinion.

Negative Reviews:
1st dislike how their TV keeps giving us problems. That we have to call the desk to bring in a technician.

2nd dislike how you guys handle things not making it strict. 

Mention 7.30am to 9.30am in the card which comes along with an access card to our room. 

Let me bring this up to your attention, Your swimming time please make it strict to avoid discomfort to other people who are trying to get some sleep and rest especially families with kids. 

Let me remind u I'm level 11 I even close my balcony door I can hear screaming and laughing till 10.30pm. I am waiting for the staff to chase them away since close at 9.30pm. So isn't there any staff hello... or security who took care of the swimming pool. So noisy and loud. Make me upset and pissed off so annoying hearing screaming and laughing after 10pm

I look at my balcony they are still swimming in the pool downstairs scream,making loud noises and giggling.
I have a 3 year old son and I am trying so hard to put him to sleep. 

I suggest please be strict with timing wise for other comfort of customers. 

3rd 
The room service cleaning took so long to clean outside my door has been around the whole day. Nobody pickup the trash? Geezz...imagine if it's my son's diapers disposal with stool omg wait the whole half day just to clean n take it away?

Service please be more prompt.. paid $250.35 per night isn't cheap hor remember that... That is just the room not included breakfast at $16 per pax. 

I even tried the breakfast but neither me nor my son seemed to dislike the breakfast buffet. Not much variety Prata too thin cereal not appealing.. just wasted the breakfast each at $16. I suggest if your booking room yes breakfast don't waste your money on breakfast with not much option to eat or just normal Prata Or etc2 for morning breakfast.

Negative Reviews:
This was our second stay in one trip. We had to stay for one more day even after facing the below mentioned issues in the same hotel as we had already pre booked it earlier.

There were a lot of issues which I am stating below:
1. 5 out of 10 staff were rude.
2. It is mentioned that it is a 4 star property and rightly so the hotel lobby looks grand but the room sizes are extremely small. They call it a superior room but nothing in it is Superior.
3. When asked for water, we were told that either to go down to the lobby to take it or to wait for half an hour more for them to send. This was after half an hour of waiting.
4. Luggage was rightly sent to our rooms on reaching. While checking out, we were asked to take them down ourselves which is totally unexpected.
5.  They clean rooms once in two days which also they do half heartedly.
6. There is no cupboard or wardrobe in the room. They don't give basic amenities. They don't give iron if asked for and much more.
7. When asked to upgrade our room, as rooms were available, we were asked to pay double the difference for room of what was available online. We offered to pay standard charges as per their portal but they wanted us to pay penalties too despite the fact that their room was in no ways superior as mentioned while booking.

Negative Reviews:

- would be nice if the room had a clothing iron and ironing board
- daily replacement of toothbrushes/toothpastes/towels felt wasteful. not very environmentally-friendly
- disrespectful and racist behaviour from large Indian family at pool, with kids splashing and screaming constantly. not really the fault of the hotel, but having a staff member nearby or monitoring/supervising the pool area would have made it a more pleasant experience

Negative Reviews:
1) Room size was tiny. Barely any room to move. No table in between the beds to keep the phone for charging also. No closet. Only 1 bag stool the other one has to be kept in small tiny place. 
2) The bathroom as well..esp. the shower was so tiny for someone like me who is just 5ft 1 inch. No hand towels..only bath towels + a towel to lay below your feet.
The shower head is at 5ft 2 inch height which made it awkward for me as well to have a bath. Imagine anyone taller than that.
3) Now the food situation is the worst. They do not have an in-house kitchen..so everything (breakfast, lunch, snacks, dinner & room service) depends on the only restaurant inside the hotel Salt and Pepper. 
Imagine catering to more than 1K- 2K people for breakfast in a 30 seat restaurant. The first day breakfast was pure chaos. It was so crowded that we barely took a few bread slices, butter and tea & sat outside.
We chose to have dinner from their room-service menu. The tomato+mushroom bruschetta were 6 slices of stale french bread with no olive oil on it and 3 with tomato & mushroom topping each. Such a bad choice. 

This hotel requires a major upgrade. With 100 rooms per floor and 10-15 floors of rooms...that's just too much. The lobby is always filled with people leaving or coming or just hanging out. 
With these massive numbers, house keeping & bell hop become slow & are late in delivery of anything. We took our own luggage & brought it down ourselves. I had asked for a refill to the tea, sugar & whitener satches for which I had to call & remind them. BTW..no creamer for tea or coffee only whitner. And the kettle was not washed from inside for months. 

I will not be recommending this Hotel to anyone even on a budget.

Meanwhile around 3am, Im woken up with a clicking sound that was so annoying, Im tried to find where the clicking sound was, at first i guess its the blind rope beed hitting the wall so I raised it up to the hanger beside, but the on and off clicking sound didnt stop, it sounds was the same sound as someone pressing the spoilt on and off button of the remote control. Im so annoyed at the same time started to find the room spooky. My partner woken up and noticed that Im feeling uncomfortable, I told him about it but at that moment the sound was gone. He told me its maybe the rain drops outside the window. I covered myself with the blanket and tried to sleep but I still can hear it until I fell asleep. Next day morning my partner told me that he heard it earlier than me and he knew its like someone pressing the remove  and he didnt wanted to scared me. Spooky Room.

Review Title: Hotel Boss is a good place for a business or solo traveler who needs a place to sleep and shower!
Negative Reviews:
Hotel lobby is always crowded with lots of people, just sitting around the whole day! Room was really tiny and only good for a guest who just wanted a bed and shower. No space to even open your bags. We were traveling to three countries for four weeks and had two 28" bags, had a struggle dealing with it. Room walls were not soundproof and you can hear all the conversations in the adjacent rooms.  Guests were very noisy and I know hotel can't do much about it, but the parties lasted way into the early morning hours and we lost sleep almost every night.  Breakfast buffet area was not clean, tables were cleaned with wet clothes which were used over and over again in all tables.  Tables were wet, sticky and unhygienic, not expected this in Singapore.  Also the staff in buffet area were not professionally trained and not helpful at all. 
Our biggest disappointment was,  we requested a room with city view but assigned a room without any view. Through balcony we were only able to see the neighbours' balcony and their drying cloths! Just wondering why we paid the extra.  Balcony had only one chair, but we are a couple, so played musical chair!! 
The original description said "with city view" as well I got an email from hotel that they will try to accommodate our request.  But they never even tried, just assigned one randomly.  
Basically we were disappointed with our stay and if we visit Singapore again, we may pick a different hotel.
Positive Reviews: Staff were friendly and very helpful. Especially the luggage holding facility staff were excellent. Reception staff were quick, professional and polite too. Also liked the 4th floor setup with pool and open space, a nice touch. Coin washer / dryer and additional shower were very useful.  Hotel location is good with short walk to malls and shopping area.  Tiny but clean functional washrooms. Beddings were clean but showing the age. Electronic safe was easy to operate and very useful.  Free water bottles daily, is much appreciated. WiFi was strong, problem free connections and TV had useful info as well Youtube!
Room Type: Superior Double Room with Balcony (Set Breakfast)

Negative Reviews:
The rooms are very small. I booked a Superior Double Room (with Set Breakfast). The day we arrived, the receptionist said I had to pay for breakfast, claiming I hadn't booked a room with breakfast included. Additionally, they gave me a standard room and insisted that I had booked a standard room without breakfast.

When we went to the room, it was too small to even fit two hand luggage pieces. We had two big and two small suitcases. We returned to the receptionist to explain that the standard room was too small to accommodate our luggage, but they argued that this was the standard room size.

I then checked my booking details and remembered that I had booked a Superior Double Room. I went back to the receptionist and showed them the booking details. They then claimed that the room they gave us was indeed the Superior Double Room. I pointed out that they had initially told me it was a standard room, which left me very disappointed with their treatment.

After showing them proof of the breakfast included in my booking, they finally acknowledged it and gave me a small piece of paper with the date to take to the restaurant for breakfast.

Overall, I was very disappointed with my experience at this hotel. I will not recommend this hotel and will not stay there again.

The location of the accommodation is undoubtedly its standout feature‚Äîconveniently situated and easily accessible. However, when it comes to the rooms, there's a noticeable disparity between the size and the price paid. Despite booking the highest-tier option, the room size didn't reflect the expected upgrade. It's a bit disappointing that the premium paid didn't translate into a more spacious and comfortable living space. Hopefully, the management considers enhancing the room amenities to better align with the pricing structure. 
I also wanted to highlight that the breakfast provided was quite disappointing. In fact, it can be described as rather pathetic. Considering the overall experience, addressing the quality and variety of the breakfast offerings would significantly contribute to a more positive stay for guests.

4) Hotel's Caf√© (Breakfast serve HALAL & Non-Halal foods)
5) No Commend on the swimming pool & gym room as i am not using for it.

* DON'T Expect spacious room as per many of country in Singapore.

Review Title: Conveniently located hotel worth its price

Positive Reviews: Extremely convenient location with Lavender MRT (and bus) just nearby, helpful luggage storage service that store it until midnight of the day you check out. Room service and staff are efficient. Linen was all clean. Hotel is easy to find, plenty of food choices nearby.

Review Title: Conveniently located hotel worth its price

Negative Reviews:
‚Ä¢Front Desk Managers & Front Desk Staffs lack of smiles & greets to guests. Only bellhop staff are friendly.
‚Ä¢In room, TV Channels are very limited. Although the TV has browser, radio & Youtube, internet reception very bad. It kept pausing & many disruptions during our watched of Youtube Movies/Videos.
‚Ä¢No bidet or spray gun at toilet cubicles.
‚Ä¢No electric iron & iron-board in room nor for room service. We have to go to 4th Floor semi- open-area laundry room wheres there's 2 shared iron & iron-boards. Theres also guests back-to-back doing their laundry which makes the space  pretty cramped.
‚Ä¢Called housekeeping for change of towels & bedsheets which they did it untidied but more dissappointed when the housekeepers never clear all the rubbish bins. Same encounter for our 3-days 2-nights stay.
‚Ä¢Daily Breakfast need to pay first everytime at front desk before we can sit in the restaurant which is very inconvenient. At one time we went down to pay but they said the breakfast all fully occupied due to overwhelming guests. The Hotel Management should do a Plan B Protocol to have slot bookings of 2-hour timings breakfast per guest if they know guests are full-house that week/month. This is to ensure that all guest get to eat their breakfast conveniently.
Positive Reviews:
‚Ä¢Fast wi-fi connection at hotel lobby & room but only for mobile phone & laptop.
‚Ä¢Family room consists of 1 superior queen bed & 1 single bedwhich is a good value for money.
‚Ä¢Certain high-rise floors overview the nice panoramic city-view.
‚Ä¢Halal-Certified Restaurant for Breakfast which is good for muslims.
‚Ä¢Big swimming pool with pool towels provided (no need for slot booking). Theres also a small gym, cash-insert massage chairs & kid's playground all at same level.
‚Ä¢Hotel location is just a walking distance to Arab Street.

Appears to cater / favour the Asian countries.  Very noisy at night with young Asian children running down corridors and people not abiding to quiet time of 10am to 7am.  Also breakfast really didn‚Äôt cater for Europeans.

4. The staff are friendly, seem happy to assist and have service mind.

Negative Reviews:
The room was quite small. We had booked for a triple room and expected it to be bigger than a double room. But it seems they just put an extra bed in a double room. So there was quite less space to move around.
There was no wardrobe/cupboards etc. to unpack the bags and put the clothes.
The Smart TV in the room has internet connection and but the network gets so slow after about 1 hour of viewing that we can't watch anything after that.
Positive Reviews:
The hotel location is good. There is a bus stop beside the hotel which makes local travel easy.
The regular check-in time is 3PM, but since our flight landed at 7AM we reached around 10AM and requested for an early check-in and the hotel staff was kind enough to provide that once we signed up for their promotional offers.
The morning breakfast was good with a lot of variety.
The swimming pool is good and clean.
View from the hotel was good, esp. since we were on a floor high up.

Negative Reviews:
A very busy hotel so not the right one to book if you want a quieter stay. During our first night we experienced strange things happening. At midnight my wife felt the bed was moving and heard (from what appears to be the next door room) a noise from a chair being dragged from end to end continuously for 5 minutes. I woke up at 2:30 AM because my phone started playing opera music even if my phone was on a 'do not disturb' mode and was silent. We've learned later on from some reviews that this is not the first time that guests had paranormal experiences. We moved to a new room in a different floor and didn't have further weird experiences.

The room doesn't have iron and ironing board so you have to go to the 4th floor if you want to do your ironing (which I think is ridiculous if you are staying in the 16th or 19th floor).
Positive Reviews: The hotel is in a very good location with plenty of dining options nearby. It is also very close to the MRT station and there's even a bus stop right outside the hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff particularly when we had an issue with our room and they offered to change our room straight away. Breakfast is average which I think is reasonable for its price. The room is reasonably clean and staff changes towels and bath mat daily. Great view from the window which really helps given the room space is a bit tight. Overall, great value for money as hotels in Singapore can be very expensive.

Review Title: Would stay again, better the devil you know..
Negative Reviews:
The room was incredibly small, but just adequate for a single traveller. Had I been travelling with a partner, I would not have been able to stay here for the full 23 nights of my trip. There was not enough hanging space, or space for more than one item of luggage. The air-conditioning, not great. Probably OK of 1 or 2 nights, but 23 nights without any fresh air in the room an issue

Whilst the hotel had a lot of bars, restaurants and independent restaurants in the building, it lacked a coffee shop which I found inconvenient. 

There were 16 lifts. however the programming meant that getting down from the top floor (19th) was difficult during peak times as the lift would stop at every floor despite being full, and the other lifts unused.

There is a large vehicle access area for taxis etc, but also need to traverse this to get to two of the bars, especially in bad weather. The really need some hard segregation between the pedestrians and vehicles  as I felt it quite dangerous at busy times.
Positive Reviews:
My city view room had an excellent view through a picture window, which made up for some of the shortcomings. Housekeeping was perfect every day, towels toiletries and water provided daily.  here was just enough space to work on computer, and wifi was good most of the time. The en-suite bathroom, small but perfect with good pressure walk in shower, and a big enough shelf for all my stuff.

Laundry facilities were excellent (washing machines and driers) as long as peak times avoided.  

Outside tables and chairs (shaded) near the pool and gym were a welcome place to work, offering shelter from sun and light rain.

The location was excellent, MRT a 5 minute walk, lots of bars and restaurants within 10 minutes walking distance.
Room Type: Superior Double Room with City View

Review Title: Overall was ok. i dnt mind staying there again.

Room cleanliness. Found cockroaches in the room and side of the bed. Curtains were dusty. 

Family members fell sick after the 1st night of staying there. 

Food panda/grab delivery table - the riders are confused where to drop of the food most of the time. 

Rooms very small. 

Too crowded , and some of the guest were very loud. 

No bidet spray with hose. Not everyone prefers to use toilet paper. 

I saw some random ladies that came up to Level 4 and went around talking and flirting with men. I thought hotel boss was a clean hotel. Not sure if there were staying there or outsiders. One lady approached and started to touch my arm. told her to go away. Lolx. 

No rain shelter to the bars and restaurant at L1.

Sofas at lobby were very dirty. 

Room Wifi was working intermittently. The youtube app(room TV) keeps crashing after an hour. videos keep buffering. had to pull out the room card to turn off the tv and turn it back on everytime it crashes. 

Hotel wifi at level 4 is very weak or not connection at times.
Positive Reviews:
We liked the the Pool and gym at level 4. The Boss Bistro and bar was convenient to have drinks at night.  

Other food shops. 

Parking was very convenient and spacious. 

Smoking corner at Level 4 with view. 

Hotel trainees were very friendly. 

Located near to shopping malls and night life areas.

Review Title: Poor hotel, rude staff, poorest in hygiene and taste
Negative Reviews:
I have stayed in various hotels across the  world including but this is the worst hotel of my life. 
Room size was too small although we paid heavy amount. Housing keeping was very poor, we need to call 5 times to make our bed sheets change.
Food was tasteless and least hygienic measures taken. Staff was cleaning the utensils in front of us and we were given wet plates at breakfast counters.
I urge booking. Com not to recommend this hotel to other people, infact booking.com should be questioned on recommending this hotels to people. They have charged decent monies but facilities are poorest.
Sorry to state, but Hotel Boss does not qualify for a 4 star hotel.

Review Title: Disappointing to say the least. Not visiting again.
Negative Reviews: Where do I start - my checkin was not smooth at all. First they gave me a key card which did not work even in lift or at the room. So went 10 floors down again to get that sorted. Then the room given was not the one I booked I call the reception and they say sorry the messed up. I don't know how that happens. I get in the room I notice dirty spoons, the lady comes and tells me we can't clean it you have to clean it. I don't know why she could not understand that I did not use them and they might be from a previous guest and so why should I clean it just give me a new one. I was there 4 days, they cleaned the room thrice but the spoon was not changed. Then in the name of environment they won't clean your room everyday. I understand not changing bed sheets but how can you say no to clean the bathroom, provide water or fresh towels for the next day. Unbelievable. The room wifi will not work after 10:30pm for some strange reason. The breakfast had the same menu for all the 4 days i was there. There was an issue on the breakfast (paid the fare with breakfast but the confirmation came without) before I started my trip is another issue altogether. Because of this they asked me to pay for the breakfast beforehand, they won't add it to your room account to pay while check-out. Strange, need money for any service upfront. When I was checking out they couldn't wait to say bye - no thank you for staying with us or please visit again or ask for feedback. I think that says a lot about the hotel. For them every guest is just a transaction. Staff was polite though.
Positive Reviews: The location is the best thing about the hotel.

The manager / staff at the reception was also super rude and said they don't clean rooms everyday!! 
Even the days when housekeeping did the rooms, it was half done. 
3) Breakfast buffet was extremely boring and tasteless except for the fruits.
4) We took a triple room which was supposed to accommodate 2 adults + 2kids. It just about fit us in with no room for free movement
5) It was an extremely busy hotel with what I'm assuming is near-full occupancy. So, they didn't seem to care about the quality or guests at all.

Review Title: FIND ANOTHER HOTEL - UNCLEAN, UNSANITARY AND NEEDS A TOTAL REFURBISHMENT (except pool area!)
Negative Reviews:
On arrival, after midnight, we were immediately greeted by a foul food odour in reception, and it followed us in the elevators & corridors. 
On our way to the room we walked through corridors with walls which looked like they'd been in a war, such were the scrapes (bullets?) and marks, the carpets so stained it may have be laid last century, and the actual door to our room bore witness to what looked like previous break-ins. (Had to double check we had arrived in Singapore, not some crime ridden US city!).
Our room was a disaster. Damaged walls, dirty floor, stink of old food (curry?), broken headboard, toilet seat broken and mirror which someone had obviously sneezed over! And even more evidence of someone having previously forced the door open - awful! 
Didn't even bother unpacking, went straight to reception to complain and change rooms... staff didn't look surprised and gave us another room. Apparently an upgrade... it wasn't! Basically the same room, but much cleaner.
The nightclub and bars under the hotel are quite sleazy looking and were still booming out music when I went outside for a cigarette at 1am, and for Singapore not to feel safe is unusual!
I think this hotel aims itself for a clientele from South Asia who maybe are too dignified to complain? So I'll complain on their and my behalf!
Breakfast is for South Asian clientele, which I don't mind, but be warned if you are looking for Western Buffet breakfast this is not available here!

To sum up.
LOOKING AT IT'S CONDITION OBVIOUSLY THE HOTEL OWNERS DON'T CARE ABOUT IT'S CLIENTELE. 
IT IS UNCLEAN, UNSANITARY AND NEEDS A TOTAL REFURBISHMENT & NEW MANAGEMENT!
THIS IS THE WORST SINGAPORE HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED IN... DO NOT STAY HERE, EVEN IF HALF PRICE!
Positive Reviews: This hotel was located in a part of Singapore that I've visited before, so location was perfect. From the street this hotel looks fine. Unfortunately our experience was totally let down by this Hotel... it's one redeeming feature is the pool area, and view from there.

Negative Reviews: 1st room given was not clean; pillow cases had stains & bed sheets had strands of hair. The shower was like pinprick of needles. When asked housekeeping to change the sheets they asked me to go to front desk to change room. I had to move everything myself to the new room. Next morning complained to the duty manager on the new room cleanliness & left for work. When I returned, the room was swept but mop or broom strands were on the floor & furniture was not moved to sweep the dust. Table tops were not wiped. Was OK for the next 2 nights as I was told housekeeping comes in every 2 days. But on Sunday morning, the only day I slept in, the housekeeping rings the doorbell at 9am to wake me up! Lost wifi for most of Friday evening & Saturday whole day. Service resumes on Monday only. Front desk staff are polite & try to help, but the housekeeping staff are below expectations. This is a hotel with 100 rooms per floor & there are at least 15 floors in that hotel; the rooms are well photographed to look spacious but in fact are quite small. The layout in the rooms are not as smart to similar sized rooms like G Hotel. Sadly disappointing experience....

Review Title: Good location but not family friendly.
Negative Reviews:
Travelled as a family of four with 2 very small kids. Rooms are tiny - barely any space for a travel cot on the floor, let alone our pram. Had to pay extra to upgrade from a triple room to a family room just so we could use the extra balcony space to dump our pram and suitcases.

Hotel being used as Covid isolation residence so that was a bit unnerving.

Housekeeping is once every 2 days because they are "going green", but when we asked them to come every day (kids make a mess!) they refused and just dumped a cardboard box of towels and water bottles in our room.

Negative Reviews:
The hotel is a come-and-go all the time. Reception isn't professional, they speak very bad English and the staff even doesn't try to understand or help you. They seem like bored and are not attentive. There are 2 breakfast types, one standard and halal. If you're not sure about which breakfast type you should take, the only explication reception gives you is: "One is on level 1 and the other on level 4".  So you have to figure it out on your own or insist - terrible service. The entrance hall has a terrible smell of petrol as the taxis come and go constantly and the smell enters from the covered parking area inside the entrance hall. 

Breakfast is mostly for asian/ indian guests, but ok. Floors in the breakfast hall are slippery and dirty, a women felt down as she slipped on the floor. Dangerous!

Let's talk about the rooms... we seemed to be landed in a horror story. The room is a small little box with no daylight and you can't open the windows. The bathroom door was scratched, air conditioning was very noisy, WiFi connection comes and goes and is so bad that you even can't read the news...we had to go to a nearby bar to do our online check-in for our next-day flight. Annoying! Besides they forgot a clean cloth in the room and we still found water from the former guests in the kettle. Disgusting. 

The pool area: only 10 sun loungers (no joke) for a hotel which is able to accommodate more than 1000 guests, most of them cracked and broken.

Luckily we only stayed 1 night but we'd never ever repeat. We travelled already to Singapore and stayed in different hotels - this one doesn't deserve 4 stars.

Think twice if you're considering booking this place.
Positive Reviews: The location, close to the metro, shopping centres and food stalls.

There was still the option to call reception & request water or extra towels, pillows. They did not have hand towels or face washers which found very odd. Did call for towels & asked for face washers with the bath towels but was told they only have bath towels & floor towel. Towels could be softer.

We stayed at ParkRoyal on Beach Road last year just nearby, and the staff were very welcoming at all times. The rooms are also extremely small.

In actual it didn't happened. We left hotel for sightseeing and we came back it still the same as we left it in the morning. So we call room service for water.

Review Title: Cheap family accommodation in a convenient location
Negative Reviews: Our room was small. A lot smaller than we were anticipating. Im glad we only used it to sleep in. The elevators were small and we often had to go down separately as a family of 5 with a pram.
Positive Reviews: Check in was easy. The staff were so friendly and only happy to help. Convenient location, walking distance to restaurants and 7/11. Getting a taxi was easy, short drives to many of the major attractions. Towels and toiletries were replaced daily. Kettle and tea facilities were put to good use. Water was also replaced daily.

Review Title: disappointing and not what we expected
Negative Reviews:
Sadly, the day that we arrived we got to our family room and it was disgusting. Within 5 minutes of being there all of our feet were black, which my little ones quickly transferred to the white bedding when they jumped on them, the floor clearly hadn't been washed for some time. 
Our first night, the Wi-Fi went down and we were unable to watch TV or use tablets etc. Not usually an issue, but when travelling with small children, something to keep them settled is a must - especially when there is no space in the room itself to play! We reported the Wi-Fi issue the next day, sadly we were told this couldn't be fixed and so the next morning we had to move rooms. (also quite annoying when you have already unpacked for 4 people). I did complain to the manager about the dirty room, no Wi-Fi and having to move - to which i was offered complimentary late checkout for our stay for the inconvenience which I appreciated very much. 
Our second room Wi-Fi wasn't great, but it was better for the majority of the time. We did not have a cleaner come in daily to re stock on water, coffee etc. and so had to call and request these to be brought to us (twice), which is another disappointing factor as I would expect this to be completed daily given the price we paid. 
Lastly, if you want to iron your clothing you will need to travel to the 4th floor where the pool is located. These are not provided or supplied in your rooms, I suspect because there is not enough space.
Positive Reviews:
The location was brilliant, very close to underground and bus stops, central location and very easy to get around. Lots of cute little pubs and cafes for food nearby. Easy walk to the local shopping mall as well. 
The entrance and lobby were beautifully decorated.
The pool and playground on site were great for the kiddos, although the park is more suited for toddlers, I would say no child over 4/5 could really make much use of it. 
The gym area is very small, but still does what it promises.
Staff were friendly and helpful during the unfortunate situations where we did feel the need to complain.

Negative Reviews:
There were a lot of issues which I am stating below:
1. 5 out of 10 staff were rude.
2. It is mentioned that it is a 4 star property and rightly so the hotel lobby looks grand but the room sizes are extremely small. They call it a superior room but nothing in it is Superior.
3. When asked for water, we were told that either to go down to the lobby to take it or to wait for half an hour more for them to send. This was after half an hour of waiting.
4. Luggage was rightly sent to our rooms on reaching. While checking out, we were asked to take them down ourselves which is totally unexpected.
5.  They clean rooms once in two days which also they do half heartedly.
6. There is no cupboard or wardrobe in the room. They don't give basic amenities. They don't give iron if asked for and much more.
7. When asked to upgrade our room, as rooms were available, we were asked to pay double the difference for room of what was available online. We offered to pay standard charges as per their portal but they wanted us to pay penalties too despite the fact that their room was in no ways superior as mentioned while booking.

Review Title: Good hotel for the budget, but don't expect too much.
Negative Reviews:
Hotel staff does not clean the room thoroughly.  Also can get too crowded.

No express elevators for the upper floors.

Hotel does not provide proper laundry service.  if you want to wash clothes, laundry is only coin-operated washing machine located on the 4th floor.  But you have to queue.  There were times also that the washing machines were inoperable.

Hotel does not provide flat irons in the room.  You need to go to the 4th floor to operate the flat irons, which is shared for all hotel guests.

location was excellent. stone's throw away from Kampong Glam. only 15 minutes away from Bugis and Mustafa Center - on foot.  More food choices because of the location.  Also 5 minutes away from MRT station, McDonalds and Kopitiam.

Wifi was also fast, but sometimes experienced intermittent signals

A self-serve laundromat at 5SG$ per wash (including soap) and 5SG$ for dryer was amazing.

One member of staff on the front desk was quite blunt and abrupt. She dealt with me whilst checking in. Had this been my first time at Hotel Boss, I would not have formed a very positive opinion. However, as I have been before I knew this was unusual. 

No indoor bathrooms for guests who have checked out of their room, but have several hours before flights, go out sightseeing and then return to collect luggage. The bathroom outside was very poor (tiny, flimsy wall and door that came unlocked while on the toilet!). A disappointing end to my stay.

I had breakfast on day one only. Rest 3 days I purposely skipped the lousy useless breakfast. Bed sheets not changed daily. Unhygienic and filthy rooms and bathrooms. Review Title: The staffs are friendly. Breakfast was terrible. The toilet was smelly. The room is small.
Negative Reviews: The room was smaller than expected. Toilet was smelly. It was dusty. More like hotel 81 type rather than those other hotels around the town. The view is excellent. The swimming pool was ok but breakfast was terrible. Was expecting a proper breakfast like fried rice or nasi lemak but instead, yellow rice and a hotdog dish, with gravy. They also have mee goreng which was also tasteless. Don't expect scrambled eggs but boiled eggs (not peeled yet) instead. Overall breakfast was really disappointing for the amount paid. Luckily enough for 2 days and 1 night stay.

Room Type: Superior Double Room with City View

Negative Reviews:
Most of the staff are incredibly rude. They tend to blame the guest for any problems. The breakfast is borderline disgusting, looks like reheated leftovers from last night. Not to mention the absolute bedlam of trying to get a table. I know this is a budget hotel (at SG$350 per night) so we expect a commensurate level of service but surely this should not mean an aggressive lack of. When I tried to speak to a housekeeper about the stain on our sheets having come back from a day out, she had the gall to tell me that "no housekeeping" whilst pushing her trolley away. Excuse me? Then when I asked for a pillow at reception, they said maximum 4pax despite accepting a Booking.com reservation for 2 adults and THREE children. The reception lady then proceeded to blame me for trying to get my child in for free! Excuse me again?!! You accept a reservation and then blame me? Yesterday when seeking a taxi, we noticed not many cabs coming. We waited for ages and it took me to ask the concierge after 10 minutes of nothing, who then informed me - very hard to get taxi now, shift change. I mean : why not say that first?

In addition, there are suggested quiet hours between 10pm and 7am - but nobody enforces and therefore nobody cares. 

This place feels and looks like a multi storey prison. If you are unlucky enough to get an inward facing room, you basically never see natural light.

Having said that, the lady who checked me in was nice, although the check in process was painfully slow for some reason. Also the concierge on day 2 helped a lot by helping book us a taxi on his own phone app. Sadly, these two people are working for a company that is so poor at basic functions that they are merely holding a thin line of service.
Positive Reviews: Location is good. Pool is nice. There is a small playground for kids. A small gym available for cardio only (no weights) - untested though.

Negative Reviews: Tha rooms were very small, needed the balcony to store the stroller. The food ordered through Room service was very average & the breakfast at the hotel restaurant was not great. All hot food options were barely warm.

And I called the reception and asked new one. They sent us. But after this, I checked the cups, they didn‚Äôt wash them. Second day, housekeeping they changed our bed sheets but I think they didn‚Äôt wash them because the upper sheet it was so dirty. There was blood. On the table, under tv, there was full of insects or begbugs I am not sure for them. They bited us during staying. And finally, third day, before leaving from the hotel, we wanted to keep our luggage in the luggage room. Bell  boys they were so rude!!! After all the thing, we paid lots of money for this bad experience. Thanks ! Check the pics.

Review Title: Location: perfect mini city break hotel
Negative Reviews:
This is a mid range budget hotel, as much as they are clean and tidy, they are shoe boxes, with little room for both me and and partner to move around at the same time in a double room.
We booked into the most basic room at first, and didn't realise the the hotel had an inner courtyard space, meaning that many rooms face towards other rooms and balconies reasonably close to your room. We felt we were unable to have privacy without consistently having the blinds lowered. Even with the blinds open, it was a fairly dark space with little light.
We did get an upgrade to a riverview room, same size, yet the view did make an huge impact with the better light and privacy.
Positive Reviews:
Location, walking distance to most of Singapore main attractions and districts, as well as bus stop right outside, huge carpark and drop off point under the hotel. Several MTR stations close by to! 
The pool was huge, with a whole level outdoors. Perfect place to relax out the way of the busyness.

Review Title: Great location , hotel was average at best
Negative Reviews: We booked a twin room for 4 days. When we arrived in the hotel we realised the room was way to small for 2 people. They should promote it as a small single room. If you are travel in a pair , expect zero space to open your suitcase if you book a twin room. Also the hotel only provided house keeping cleaning service once every 2 days which is fairly odd.  In addition the twin room had a terrible internal building view which was massively disappointing
Positive Reviews: Location was great , a lot of halal food places near by

Negative Reviews: No Muslim shower, when alot of places in singapore now have bidets. Also rooms were very small. Good for Muslims as Arab street was right ahead. We had a room with a greatttt view
Positive Reviews: Location. Good service.

Negative Reviews: The rooms are tiny, no space, no cupboard.  Bathroom very small and old, didn't always look clean, toilet paper too rough and same paper they used for tissues.  Balcony is useless as it just faces an internal triangle of other rooms but dark and no view at all.  The staff were slow to respond and not very welcoming or competent.
Positive Reviews: Pool was huge so very good.  Location close to train, little india and Arab street and Mosque was good.

Negative Reviews:
i didn't like almost everything about this place.
absolutely shockingly Small in almost every aspect. it is very fancy outside with no substance inside.
the concierge did not even tried to great us or help with luggage. There were so many people in reception that you felt as another small fish in the tank. We were greeted by reception staff that just followed "the book" and protocol to check us in and move to the next guest
Rooms are shockingly small and all photography has been done with wide lenses and marking purposes.
when you are in the room and the bag is on the floor to take things out (note- there is no other place for it at all anyway) you need to jump over the bag to get to your bed.
It's a shocker for the amount of money they charge.
as i wrote a review on a trip advisor, i missed a few key signs in the first place:
why would a good hotel put a photo of laundry in the featured photos??!!
I have been asked to pay in full for the whole stay at check in!! what it means to us is that it's a point of no return - you can't check out after the first ruined night and move to another place.
the third one - watch for the hangers in the room above the TV !! the rooms are so "practical" that there is no space for a wardrobe!
before checking I sent some messages - there was no reply either.
The bathroom is so small that there is no space to put a toilet paper roll, and there is NO Toilet paper at all. There are  paper tissues somewhere above your head.
Also, you can forget about sitting on the toilet normally!! - there is no space to put your leg normally - the show glass is next to the seat.!
if you get an internal corner room, you will face another window 2 meters away from another hotel room, and if you're not feeling yourself already in the prison and want to look outside, you will see reflection of yourself which is not limited to your own but also reflections or views of all your neighbours across multiple floors ..
Positive Reviews: Tell you honestly there was nothing to like about it except location .,.. sorry.

The rooms were  not noise proof - inconsiderate guests that cant read (Quiet time between 10pm and 7am) were heard clearly in our room andrunning water from another room could be heard.  The hotel is large and doesn't really cater a lot for English speaking guests,  from layout and food choices available at breakfast,  and when tea bags in the room ran out - they did not replace them and when I asked the cleaner replied they don't stock them.
To be fair to this hotel my choice was not the best - if I was a traveller that was keen to see Singapore and only wanted to sleep in the hotel this hotel would be fine - I was coming back from a full on holiday in Japan looking for a bit of relaxation before I came home so it wasn't a good fit

The toilet had so much of stains on the walls and the sink couldnt drain well. The tissue quality was bad, shower pressure was high and shower head couldnt stay on the holder. The room had a balcony which had a sticky stain on the floor causing us the inconvenience of having to wear out slippers whenever we needed to go into the balcony. There was no bedroom slippers available. The YOUTUBE was not playing smoothly and it disrupted our entertainment plans to have a sing along session.  We anticipated fun time at the pool, but the minute i went in wearing my goggles, I could see so much of impurities floating in the water. It was a disgusting sight to see clumps of hair floating in the water as well. The water was so cloudy and after a while we saw a cleaner using a nets to fish the impurities out of the pool. Could he have cleaned the whole pool using the net? And he was cleaning the pool while guests were still swimming. It was very disgusting. I will never choose to return back to this hotel. The hygiene and cleanliness despite covid season is very bad. I am utterly disappointed that tourist will have to see and compare the state of a hotel in Singapore. We should be proud of our hotels but this experience ruined my staycation mood. It would be good to have the management call me over a chat about the cleanliness.

Review Title: Nope, not for me - Hotel Boss is yuck & rooms are small with too many guests and not enough space
Negative Reviews:
We arrived from our flight at nearly midnight and the reception area was busy with people sitting and standing around everywhere, some with suitcases, but I have no idea what they were all doing there in the reception at that hour, it was so loud. There was a roped line up section for reception so we stood with our suitcases in the line-up area and people just kept ignoring the line-up (we were the only people lining up) and they just kept walking straight up to the desk.... Eventually 1 staff member called us over and 1 of the guy's that had walked up to the reception desk trying to push in just stood there the whole time watching us check-in....

The room was the smallest I have ever stayed in and not very well cleaned or maintained - I would describe it as yuck! I felt sick when I walked in, it was just gross. No space for 2 suitcases, the bathroom was tiny. We had a room with a balcony and I think the balcony may have been about the same size as the room, so that was where we stayed when we were there except when we needed to sleep or shower etc, but to be honest, we just tried to avoid going back to the hotel. The bed was very small also.

If anyone was in the hallway, you could hear them very clearly from the room. You could also hear the people in neighboring rooms. The walls are paper thin.

After a while we figured out that Hotel Boss is pretty close to Little India Singapore and most of the other guests were Indian.

Breakfast at the hotel was the worst experience for us during our stay. This hotel can accommodate 1500 guests, yet the breakfast area can only seat about 60 people. So basically you walk into the breakfast restaurant and there are people everywhere with no tables available. It was an absolute pig-sty! Food everywhere, all over the benches, all over the floor. The staff were trying to clear tables but couldn't get through because there were just waaaaay too many people in there.
Positive Reviews: The only positive thing I can say is the staff were nice and doing the best they can under the circumstances. We asked for a late check-out and they gave us an additional 2 hours without any extra $$.

Negative Reviews:
The hotel is very modern and set up to receive a large number of guests, but it is not without faults. I spent 6 nights in a noisy room which to define a ‚Äústorage closet‚Äù is a compliment. To make the situation even worse, the clogged bathroom sink which was unblocked only after three days and four requests for intervention.
My reservation was for a "superior room with balcony and breakfast set" which, according to the description by Booking, should have been 18m2. In reality, the measured surface area, including the bathroom, was only TWELVE square meters. The photographs, of course, are very misleading and show a situation of much higher quality than reality.
The balcony was on the internal courtyard, therefore with a very limited view, but the real problem was the noise deriving from the air conditioning system placed on the roof, whose noisy motors severely limited the possibility of remaining outside. Furthermore, the access door to the balcony, lacking a valid seal, let most of the noise filter inside the room, making sleep very difficult.
The problems don't end there. The included breakfast offers very limited choice and no variation from day to day. Basically for six days we always ate the same things (often cold). The only positive note is the freshly ground coffee.
Extremely negative final judgment, considering the price. The hotel would be 4 stars, but I would say that maybe just 2 stars would be enough. Only two positive things: the swimming pool and the always scrupulous cleaning.
Positive Reviews: the swimming pool and the always scrupulous cleaning
Room Type: Superior Double Room with Balcony (Set Breakfast)

Review Title: I do not recommend this hotel.
Negative Reviews: I do not recommend this hotel. We booked for two people and an infant but the rooms were not big enough for our travel cot and our stroller. The rooms are really small, even for two people with normal luggage! We complained that the room were too small for our booking. And also that it was a fire hazard as we would need to shuffle all of our luggage around before managing to exit the room as there were litterally no floor space left. However, we were told that when booking with infant they assume the infant will sleep in our bed! We asked if we could get a bigger room, but they did not meet our request. We ended up asking the staff to remove furniture out of the room to make room for the infant in the room and we had to shuffle all of our stuff around in the room to get in an out. Also, the room was poorly cleaned, we fond some left stuff behind for other guest in the room upon arrvial, and the toilet were very dirty, not pleasant at all. Also, we arrived for breakfast 20 min before closing and there were almost nothing left. They did not have what you expect to be continental breakfast and it was not very good, so we skipped breakfast and went out eating instead. I will not return back to this hotel.

1) Rooms were dusty. Bathroom walls and ceiling had fungus. 
2)When our rooms weren't done/cleaned on day 2, we called reception to ask for emptying our overflowing garbage bins and changing the dirty towels atleast. The response from staff was rude when we requested for the same (one person said I have other jobs and walked away with me holding the garbage bin). The manager / staff at the reception was also super rude and said they don't clean rooms everyday!! 
Even the days when housekeeping did the rooms, it was half done. 
3) Breakfast buffet was extremely boring and tasteless except for the fruits.
4) We took a triple room which was supposed to accommodate 2 adults + 2kids. It just about fit us in with no room for free movement
5) It was an extremely busy hotel with what I'm assuming is near-full occupancy. So, they didn't seem to care about the quality or guests at all.

Review Title: At over SGD 135 a night you need to provide TV and make up the room daily at a minimum.
Negative Reviews:
They say they are green and will change towels/sheets after 2 nights, but they don't.  They don't even leave a refill on coffee, tea mixes or water each day and they never empty rubbish bins or even take them away from your door if you put them out in the corridor.
They don't always answer room service phones and so when you go to the front desk and ask them for a wake up call for the airport when you leave tomorrow, they don't manage to give you that call.  You could sleep in and miss your flight!
They have obviously had a contract failure with their provider of TV channels and so they have only 5 that are foreign language mostly .... five channels and nothing on.  The whole place has a feeling of going broke financially and they probably have been due to Covid and a tourism collapse.

Review Title: If you don't mind not being able to sleep, this is the Hotel for you.
Negative Reviews:
The rooms are tiny.
The bed is very uncomfortable - feels like a huge sack of damp magazines formed the "Mattress".
The pillows were painful to sleep on - like sleeping on a Christmas Turkey that had been stuffed into a cloth bag.
The walls are paper thin, so you can hear everything going on with the other 200 guests on your floor. The plumbing rattles around constantly, so every time someone went to the bathroom on the floor above, you could feel the product ratting down the pipes. 
The air conditioning has two main settings: A) "Frozen Face", and B) "Sauna". The third setting "Condensation on your bed-side table and nose" was a possible third option for about 5 minutes. Then "Frozen Face" came back. 
The TV has 5 channels (not the good ones!), with the saving grace being a "you-tube" button on the remote. It only lasts for 7 minutes before it freezes up and the router needs to be re-set by the front desk. 
The breakfast was poor.
Positive Reviews:
1) The Manager, William, was very good and did a good job of accommodating my requests. The other problems with the hotel (see below) were outside of his control. 

2) The Main Entrance was huge.
Room Type: Superior Double Room with City View (Set Breakfast)

Breakfast was poor, gave me a dodgy stomach. Reception is so busy and hectic, cross between wolf of wall St and a busy train station in India. I have been to many countries and stayed in various rated hotels, this was by far the worst one. I would not recommend this one to anyone. I ruined my experience of the country I could not wait to get back home.

Review Title: Overall it was a very bad experience. Definitely do not recommend!
Negative Reviews:
On the first night, we were assigned to room 1345 which was right beside the elevator. My friends and I were unable to sleep the entire night due to loud clanking metal sounds coming from the elevator. Luckily we managed to get a room change in the morning at 8am after being kept up the entire night. The walls were so thin you could hear babies crying and people sneezing from your room. 

The rooms were not like the photo shown. It is exceptionally small and you can barely walk with your luggage opened. The towels weren‚Äôt exceptionally clean. On some days it came with stains and had to be changed. There was no Do Not Disturb signage in the room hence we had to call the front desk and ask the service staff not to disturb us in the day. However, they still knock on the door every single day while we were resting to clean the room. Message did not seem to be conveyed between the front desk and service staff. 

I stayed there for a week and every night I see many people sleeping in the lobby. They were lying flat on the couches and nobody seemed to be care. It was such an ugly sight.

Negative Reviews: Nothing specific to highlight;
Positive Reviews: We had booked for a triple bed room and had a smooth check in, with early check in by an hour as requested. The rooms are small inline with the typical hotel rooms in Singapore but had all the necessary facilities. The view from the room was awesome with superb view of the singapore town center. At the fourth floor, the restaurant serving breakfast , washer/dryer and swimming pool was there. The swimming pool was large and clean where me and my son had a relaxing time; By the swimming pool side, we had fresh towels and drinking water available; The breakfast was typical singaporean fare with not much indian food options and is average. The location of the hotel is good for taking MRT/bus to all the attractions. Little India is 750 meters away on the same road. There is a nearby Mcdonalds near the Lavendar MRT station. So food wise you are covered.

Negative Reviews: See above.
Positive Reviews:
This hotel was a real mix of positives and negatives but for us, the positives outweighed the negatives. 

Good stopover for a few nights to rest and recover between flights. 

Positives:
- Flexible checkin and check out. We had a horrible long-haul flight and got in early in the morning. Being able to check in early really helped us out (though, of course this is subject to availability).
- Kids playground, gym, massage chairs and swimming pool.
- Big balcony (for the balcony rooms).
- Good location.

Negatives:
- Wifi is intermittent sometimes not available 
- room without balcony is not big but normal for singapore
- food in restaurants, particularly breakfast not good but there are good options right next door.

Room Type: Superior Double Room with City View

Negative Reviews:
The initial room smelt like smoke and was horrible. Complained and relocated room which smelt better. 
I had paid for a balcony - do not bother because it faces everyone else's balcony so no actual view. The room was so small that our luggage did not fit (x2 cases) we had to leave these on the balcony. The room wallpaper was horrible and taped together with I don't know what. The shower and bathroom were OK however the logistics of the shower was awkward - the door opened out not inwards seems picky but it was so small it was near impossible to get in and out.
They cleaned the room every 2 days - we asked for toilet paper and the lady didn't understand so I took it off her trolly which she didn't mind but then we couldn't fit it properly - another awkward aspect. 

The overall room was completely a cat fish to the photos showed online as well as the gym it is tiny!! 
The pool looked OK although we didn't use due to busy schedules. 

I don't think it was value for money especially since I paid extra to have a balcony which was utter pointless. 

Overall if your not bothered and just want to sleep great but I felt completely cat fished and wouldn't have spent what I did if I had known. 

Breakfast was OK - very set menu in terms of what they offered which mostly catered to other cultures. Which was fine we mainly ate toast and fruit.

Review Title: Stay somewhere else... Better options elsewhere
Negative Reviews:
A lot of the staff are aggressively unhelpful. Despite taking my booking for 5 pax, I was refused a 5th pillow, on the basis that the maximum was 4. I was also then subjected to an interrogation like quiz, where the staff member basically accused me of smuggling in my 4yo son. When I asked a housekeeper, she told me "no housekeeping". Utterly ridiculous.

Breakfast is bedlam, not very clean or hygienic as the busboys only collect used plates and cutlery, they don't always wipe down with cleanser. It was always filled to the rafters with people fighting over very ordinary tepid food. During one breakfast, there were no knives at all. Butter and jam had to be applied with a spoon.

Taxi area is also bedlam. The concierge will only help you if you ask them, it is not offered. Best to use your own devices...

It is an extremely busy hotel so queues for everything. The pool area is an incongruous oasis of calm and tranquillity - it wouldn't be out of place in a 4 or 5 star venue. Unfortunately not enough to make up for the terrible service. Appreciate it is a budget hotel but it's not that cheap, and I really expected better.
Positive Reviews: Very nice and spacious pool area with small children's playground, ample restaurants on site and 24h convenience store.

Review Title: Pay a little more and choose a better hotel.
Negative Reviews:
On arrival, was made to sign up to their mailing list in order to check in early, which wasn't very fair. Staff not particularly friendly. 

The rooms are absolutely tiny, wasn't even enough room for our suitcases. Windows do not open, WiFi didn't work. 

Our bed linen was ripped along one of the seams

The restaurant staff were rude when we asked to sit inside the restaurant as we didn't want to sit out in the hotel lobby, and they wouldn't let us because our 6yr old very well Behaved daughter was with us. So we decided to eat elsewhere. 

Breakfast was carnage, completely packed in to a tiny room and was a free for all to grab what food was brought out. Not enjoyable and the food we did manage to get was poor quality. 

The swimming pool was freezing, but worst of all it was full of long black hairs. Every length I swam I got hairs in my mouth and stuck around my fingers, absolutely disgusting. The surface of the water also had a film of grease or something on top. 

Location is average, not really walkable to any place of interest, but at least grab taxi's are reasonably priced.

Negative Reviews: Room was very small. No wardrobes, drawers or closets provided to put away clothes. Had to leave all the clothes in my luggage. Door and walls were paper thin. Breakfast was terrible, food was not appetising or seemed fresh. Rooms had no irons or hairdryers which are standard for 4* hotels. Lobby was chaos with people scattered everywhere. Shocked it is rated as a 4* as more akin to a 1*. Location was decent, however, Singapore is very dense so not hard to be far away from anywhere.
